comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: John Henry Slattery was born in New York, served in the Colorado State House of Representatives, 1911-1914, and was speaker of the State House in 1914;  he died in 1933.  When he wasn't a legislator, he was in the mining business.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Logan Republican. (Logan, Utah) 1902-1924, May 07, 1914, Image 4 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85058246/1914-05-07/ed-... indicates that Slattery had just been selected as Democratic Caucus candidate for speaker of the Colorado House, ensuring his election as speaker. Presumably the picture with the gavel is after he was made Speaker.
